get.description: Get all bank accounts of this entity.

parameters.description: The ID of the entity that owns the requested resource.

schema.description: The ID of the entity that owns the requested resource.

parameters.name: x-monite-entity-id

post.description:
Add a new bank account for the specified entity.

The minimum required fields are `currency` and `country`. Other required fields depend on the country:

* EU bank accounts require `iban`.
* UK bank accounts require `account_number` and `sort_code`.
* US bank accounts require `account_number` and `routing_number`. Additionally, `account_holder_name`
  is required for ACH payments.

For airwallex_plaid it generates Plaid Link token to init the Plaid SDK.

get.description:
Lists all payables from the connected entity.

If you already have the data of the payable (amount in [minor units](
https://docs.monite.com/docs/currencies#minor-units), currency, vendor information, and other details)
stored somewhere as individual attributes, you can create a payable with these attributes by calling [POST
/payables](https://docs.monite.com/reference/post_payables) and providing the [base64-encoded](
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) contents of the original invoice file in the field `base64_encoded_file`.

A payable is a financial document given by an entity`s supplier itemizing the purchase of a good or a service and
demanding payment.

The `file_name` field is optional. If omitted, it defaults to default_file_name. If the settings are configured
to automatically set `suggested_payment_term`, this object can be omitted from the request body.

The `id` generated for this payable can be used in other API calls to update the data of this payable or trigger [
status transitions](https://docs.monite.com/docs/payable-status-transitions), for example. essential data
fields to move from `draft` to `new`

Related guide: [Create a payable from data](https://docs.monite.com/docs/collect-payables#create-a-payable-from-data)

See also:


[Automatic calculation of due date](https://docs.monite.com/docs/collect-payables#automatic-calculation-of-due-date)

[Suggested payment date](https://docs.monite.com/docs/collect-payables#suggested-payment-date)

[Attach file](https://docs.monite.com/docs/collect-payables#attach-file)

[Collect payables by email](https://docs.monite.com/docs/collect-payables#send-payables-by-email)

[Manage line items](https://docs.monite.com/docs/manage-line-items)

post.description:
Mark a payable as paid.

Payables can be paid using the payment channels offered by Monite or through external payment channels. In the latter
 case, the invoice is not automatically marked as paid in the system and needs to be converted to the paid status
 manually.

Optionally, it is possible to pass the `comment` field in the request body, to describe how and when the invoice was
paid.

To use this endpoint with an entity user token, this entity user must have a role that includes the `pay` permission for
payables.

Related guide: [Mark a payable as paid](https://docs.monite.com/docs/payable-status-transitions#mark-as-paid)

See also:

[Payables lifecycle](https://docs.monite.com/docs/payables-lifecycle)

[Payables status transitions](https://docs.monite.com/docs/collect-payables#suggested-payment-date)

post.summary: Mark a payable as partially paid
post.description:
Mark a payable as partially paid.

If the payable is partially paid, its status is moved to `partially_paid`. The value of the `amount_paid` field must be
  the sum of all payments made, not only the last one.

Notes:
- This endpoint can be used for payables in the `waiting_to_be_paid` status.
- The `amount_paid` must be greater than 0 and less than the total payable amount specified by the `amount` field.
- The `amount_paid` can be either increased or decreased to reflect reversed payments and chargebacks.
- You can use this endpoint multiple times for the same payable to reflect multiple partial payments, always setting the
 sum of all payments made.
- To use this endpoint with an entity user token, this entity user must have a role that includes the `pay`
permission for payables.

Related guide: [Mark a payable as partially paid](https://docs.monite.com/docs/payable-status-transitions#mark-as-partially-paid)

See also:

[Payables lifecycle](https://docs.monite.com/docs/payables-lifecycle)

[Payables status transitions](https://docs.monite.com/docs/collect-payables#suggested-payment-date)

[Mark a payable as paid](https://docs.monite.com/docs/payable-status-transitions#mark-as-paid)

you need to provide the data for either the `individual` or `organization` property.

processed_text.description:
If the `text` value is identified as a currency amount or a date, `processed_text` contains this value converted to a common format:

* Currency amounts (such as the total, subtotal, tax/VAT, line item prices) are converted to numbers with the currency character removed. For example, "1,125.00" becomes 1125.0.* Dates are converted to the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format, `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss`. For example, "26/3/2021" becomes "2021-03-26T00:00:00".

If `text` is not a currency amount or a date, `processed_text` is `null`.

ae_trn - United Arab Emirates TRN (123456789012345)
au_abn - Australian Business Number (AU ABN) (12345678912)
au_arn - Australian Taxation Office Reference Number (123456789123)
bg_uic - Bulgaria Unified Identification Code (123456789)
br_cnpj - Brazilian CNPJ number (01.234.456/5432-10)
br_cpf - Brazilian CPF number (123.456.789-87)
ca_bn - Canadian BN (123456789)
ca_gst_hst - Canadian GST/HST number (123456789RT0002)
ca_pst_bc - Canadian PST number (British Columbia) (PST-1234-5678)
ca_pst_mb - Canadian PST number (Manitoba) (123456-7)
ca_pst_sk - Canadian PST number (Saskatchewan) (1234567)
ca_qst - Canadian QST number (Qubec) (1234567890TQ1234)
ch_vat - Switzerland VAT number (CHE-123.456.789 MWST)
cl_tin - Chilean TIN (12.345.678-K)
es_cif - Spanish NIF number (previously Spanish CIF number) (A12345678)
eu_oss_vat - European One Stop Shop VAT number for non-Union scheme (EU123456789)
eu_vat - European VAT number (ATU12345678)
gb_vat - United Kingdom VAT number (GB123456789)
ge_vat - Georgian VAT (123456789)
hk_br - Hong Kong BR number (12345678)
hu_tin - Hungary tax number (adszm) (12345678-1-23)
id_npwp - Indonesian NPWP number (12.345.678.9-012.345)
il_vat - Israel VAT (000012345)
in_gst - Indian GST number (12ABCDE3456FGZH)
is_vat - Icelandic VAT (123456)
jp_cn - Japanese Corporate Number (*Hjin Bang*) (1234567891234)
jp_rn  Japanese Registered Foreign Businesses' Registration Number (*Troku Kokugai Jigysha no Troku Bang*) (12345)  # noqa
kr_brn - Korean BRN (123-45-67890)
li_uid - Liechtensteinian UID number (CHE123456789)
mx_rfc - Mexican RFC number (ABC010203AB9)
my_frp - Malaysian FRP number (12345678)
my_itn - Malaysian ITN (C 1234567890)
my_sst - Malaysian SST number (A12-3456-78912345)
no_vat - Norwegian VAT number (123456789MVA)
nz_gst - New Zealand GST number (123456789)
ru_inn - Russian INN (1234567891)
ru_kpp - Russian KPP (123456789)
sa_vat - Saudi Arabia VAT (123456789012345)
sg_gst - Singaporean GST (M12345678X)
sg_uen - Singaporean UEN (123456789F)
si_tin - Slovenia tax number (davna tevilka) (12345678)
th_vat - Thai VAT (1234567891234)
tw_vat - Taiwanese VAT (12345678)
ua_vat - Ukrainian VAT (123456789)
us_ein - United States EIN (12-3456789)
za_vat - South African VAT number (4123456789)
unknown - None of the above (Anything's possible here)

id.description: A unique ID of this file.

created_at.description: UTC date and time when this workflow was uploaded to Monite. Timestamps follow the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

file_type.description: The type of the business object associated with this file.

md5.description: The MD5 hash of the file.

pages.description: If the file is a PDF document, this property contains individual pages extracted from the file. Otherwise, an empty array.

previews.description: Preview images generated for this file. There can be multiple images with different sizes.

region.description: Geographical region of the data center where the file is stored.

url.description: The URL to download the file.

entities__v2022_11_16__schemas__file_sav.description:
When a PDF document is uploaded to Monite, it extracts individual pages from the document
and saves them as PNG images. This object contains the image and metadata of a single page.
A preview image generated for a file.
